name: Premier Inn Coventry South (A45)

reviews.text: Finding this in the dark was not easy because the post code in the sat nav does not take you to the entrance which I could not find in the dark. I am surprised no-one else mentions this. It could do with an an Entrance sign on the drive. Look for the Harvester Pub and drive in there. My room was unheated despite being booked and it turned out the heater did not work. The staff were very helpful and got me a standing heater which worked fine. They also put it on for me on my arrival on the second night. Bed was very comfortable and I slept well. Compared to other Premier Inns it was only average tho' I thought- the Shower smelt when I went in the first time; the remote control on the TV stuck a bit; the heat did not work and I could not really regulate the temp. of the standing heater. But the staff were helpful and did their best to sort the heating, bringing me an extra duvet in case. I had a reasonable rate booking early and it is convenient for the University.
reviews.title: Arriving in the dark you can miss the entrance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent.
reviews.title: Premier Inn coventry

reviews.text: What more can i say ?
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: just what I expect fm Premier inn
reviews.title: Clean Hotel

reviews.text: Had a weekend away staying two nights in order to go to the NEC in Birmingham which was a short stay away. Room clean and breakfast was excellent, placing your orders which is much better than buffet option.
reviews.title: quick stop

reviews.text: Great service, fantastic staff, clean, good food. What more could you ask for for the price. A very pleasent surprise.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: clean and friendly hotel with excellent road links.
reviews.title: Convinent Location

reviews.text: We stayed as a group of 4 adults and 2 under 5's for 3 nights over the jubilee weekend occupying 1 double and 1 family room both of which were very clean, modern and comfortable. We opted for breakfast each morning which we found to be of a good standard.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.text: As previously stated by other reviews the entrance is not well signed and we found the attached Harvester to be a bit 'rough around the edges' but what stood out for us was the PI staff all of whom were pleasant, friendly and extremely helpful and patient (remember the 2 under 5's)
reviews.title: Good value stay - very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed as part of a group attending a wedding close by. The hotel itself met our needs well - the room was very clean as was the hotel restaurant. Really good value for a two night stay. Particular recommendations go to the staff who were extremely friendly - nice to see these days! Couple of downsides - the hotel is a bit tricky to find from the main road (Look for the petrol station / M&S as it's opposite there) and, as it's next to a Harvester pub, it did get a bit noisy in the early hours - but all in all, if all you need is a quick stopover then this does the trick
reviews.title: Typical Premier Inn

reviews.text: Normally very happy with Premier and been using them for years. Nothing wrong with stay apart from hearing constant all night coughing from couple next door. First time in a Premier Inn I have heard another room so if you are a light sleeper best to go to another one.
reviews.title: Soundproofing not up to normal standard.

reviews.text: Excellent location and found this hotel to be of the same high standard as always found with Premier Inn, lovely friendly staff and clean comfy rooms. Would certainly recommend to anyone staying in the Coventry area
reviews.title: Good hotel good location

reviews.text: Excellent modernised premier inn. Wasn't expecting to stay in Cov and booked this place last minute, arrived at hotel about 15mins after booking online. Room was ready and everything fine. Nice family room. My only criticism would be the size of the TV, many PI now have 32 inch TVs whereas these are only about 20 inch.
reviews.title: Good quality modern Premier inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for visiting Coventry Cathedral, Stratford-upon-Avon, Kenilworth etc. Good clean rooms, no noise from roads. On-site breakfast room meaing no trudging to restaurant next door, although being a Harvester this is well-recommended for dinner after a hard days sightseeing.
reviews.title: Usual Premier Standard
Excellent location but very small family room
reviews.text: We booked this 1-night stay on a whim! Excellent location for visiting Kenilworth, Leamington Spa and Warwick. Spotlessly clean, quiet and really liked the shower-only bathroom with the door that can close off the toilet so the rest of the family can use the bathroom. Prefer this 'made to order' cooked breakfast rather than buffet and loved the internal 'breakfast room' (not part of the restaurant next door) run by Premier Inn staff but wonder if it might be a bit small if the hotel is full. Also like the new choice of pillows in the room. My only complaint was this room was not big enough for a family of 4 (although this could be because we booked online that morning) meaning no gaps to walk between the beds and the pull-out bed (mattress on the floor) was very uncomfortable for my 11-year old son. We have had much better family rooms at other Premier Inns.
The Premier Inn here maintains the standard you expect. By no means a luxury stay, with no frills of any kind, it still hits above its weight as a budget brand.
reviews.title: Up to the usual standard

reviews.text: This one is well located for access in to town and for travelling further afield - it is on the A45. It was actually quiet, which surprised me given its proximity to the road.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The staff were excellent, smiling and very helpful.
reviews.title: Good value for money at premier inn.

reviews.text: No hotel restaurant (except for breakfast) but there is a pub next door and it is no hardship getting in to town by car.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Coventry South (A45)

reviews.text: I stayed here on business in May/June 2012 for a week. While I wouldn't specifically complain about anything, it's not the best Premier Inn I've stayed at by a long way. Unsually, the week I spent here was unbelivably hot and there is no air con atthe hotel, though they had provided electric fans. This was an issue for me until I gave myself a slap and wondered why I was being so fussy. It's not like I have air con at home!
reviews.title: Budget done brilliantly

aka: Premier Inn Coventry South (a45) Hotel Coventry
description: A friendly, quiet hotel. We serve a range of breakfasts including the all you can eat Premier Breakfast, Continental, Grab and Go, & 2 children under the age of 16 can eat for free if 1 adult purchases the Premier Breakfast. Most guests take dinner at the Harvester which is located just a short walk away from the hotel so very convenient & great value for money. All rooms have showers provided (no baths) & have been refurbed to the Premier Inn standards. It would be advisable to pre-book in advance as we are very popular, serving Warwick University, Stoneleigh Park & the Birmingham NEC amongst many other attractions & facilities. We offer free car parking facilities, Wifi is available for 30 minutes for free our you can purchase extra Wifi time at reception or from the comfort of you room online. No pets, assistance dogs are welcome. Breakfast is served in our onsite breakfast area & is a great place for our guests to relax together or catch up on work. This area is available for small meetings if required. We look forward to welcoming you.
